para.sentence: \Gamma\left(z\right)=\lim_{k\to\infty}\frac{k!k^{z}}{z(z+1)\cdots(z+k)}, if z\neq 0,-1,-2,\dots, \frac{1}{\Gamma\left(z\right)}=ze^{\gamma z}\prod_{k=1}^{\infty}\left(1+\frac{ z}{k}\right)e^{-z/k}, \left|\frac{\Gamma\left(x\right)}{\Gamma\left(x+\mathrm{i}y\right)}\right|^{2} =\prod_{k=0}^{\infty}\left(1+\frac{y^{2}}{(x+k)^{2}}\right), if x\neq 0,-1,\dots.

If \sum_{k=1}^{m}a_{k}=\sum_{k=1}^{m}b_{k}, then \prod_{k=0}^{\infty}\frac{(a_{1}+k)(a_{2}+k)\cdots(a_{m}+k)}{(b_{1}+k)(b_{2}+k )\cdots(b_{m}+k)}=\frac{\Gamma\left(b_{1}\right)\Gamma\left(b_{2}\right)\cdots \Gamma\left(b_{m}\right)}{\Gamma\left(a_{1}\right)\Gamma\left(a_{2}\right) \cdots\Gamma\left(a_{m}\right)}, provided that none of the b_{k} is zero or a negative integer.
